projects.title: CIME Forum 2014 in Peru
projects.description: The 6th Annual CIME Forum took place in Lima, Peru where we welcomed around 100 media professionals and students to discuss media ethics issues of Latin-America.

projects.title: 2nd International Media Ethics Day
projects.description:
Media ethics workshops at 22 locations around the globe in collaboration with local media organisations and professionals. Approximately 500 journalists participated in the workshops. Several online activities were also implemented, such as media ethics quiz on social media, intensive blogging and a special online course on J-Ethinomics.

The aim of the Media Ethics Day is to mobilize the journalism community and provide journalists around the world with an opportunity to discuss media ethics issues, examine case studies, and participate in role-plays and debates related to the various ethical dilemmas they might expect to face on the job.

contributors.headline: Digital Marketing Consultant | Marketing Strategist | Entrepreneur

projects.title: CIME Forum 2012
projects.description: The 4th annual forum of the Center for International Media Ethics was a unique opportunity for South Asian journalists to participate in media ethics discussions and training. We try to target journalists in remote areas, such as Bhutan - the forum location,  where the media has a crucial role in shaping the new democratic society. In Bhutan the Gross National Happiness is the most important indicator of the country's situation and journalism has a crucial impact on how people see their situation and how they think about things that happen around them. This directly contributes to their happiness and therefore the well-being of the nation. 70 media professionals attended the two day workshop and training.

projects.title: 1st International Media Ethics Day
projects.description: At this worldwide event we organised 11 workshops in 11 different countries with local host organisations. More than 300 journalists participated in workshop discussions and exercises on this day in their local language. The point was to bring local journalists together to solve real case scenarios and discuss their dilemmas by the supervision of a professional media organisation. We also offered intensive blogging, and quiz for the online participants.

contributors.headline: Legal Director - South Yorkshire Refugee Law and Justice
Turkey and Middle East correspondent at Guardian News & Media

projects.title: CIME Forum 2011
projects.description: The CIME Forum is the annual event of the Center for International Media Ethics. The third time it was organised in Budapest, Hungary serving as a platform for media experts from the Central and Eastern European region. Besides the ethics of media self-regulation, the local issues of investigative journalism were discussed. 10 panelists gave their view to the 30 journalists present at the event and we also awarded the 1st CIME Ambassador nomination there.

volunteer_experiences.description: Leading the work of the association which aims to bring staff members and pensioners together from different departments, nationalities and interest groups through social and cultural activities.

As board member of Family Enrichment Nederland (FEN), I help organise workshops, events for couples and parents to improve their family life, as well as young professionals to prepare for their future. I am also a moderator for FEN, specialised in communication related topics.

Organising fundraising events and actions to support Bulgarian orphanages
E.g. at a 2019 Christmas raffle, raised 2000 EUR
https://www.chichofoundation.org/

Suggesting and organising staff events (100-400 participants) and social activities, e.g. environmental spring family day, casino Christmas party, staff badminton championship.
Arranging announcements, posters, videos, registrations, event logistics, follow-up.
Responsible for social media, website and the launch of the organisation's new blog.
Contributing to the management of the project's Facebook page.

Designed 2012 calendar for Christmas sale. In the process of selling.
The funds collected will support an aquaduct project in Congo and an orphan village in Tanzania supported by the Fondazione Renato Grandi.

Fundraised for the installation of a water pump for the community health centre of Mangily, a village on the west coast of Madagascar. 
Activities: fundraising cycling tour, Easter egg sale, Solidarity Cookbook, Solidarity Mug, human rights forum.
Funds raised: approximately 10.000 euros
The project was selected by the Europe Third World non-profit organisation.
